Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty nice. The breakfast room is not big, but we always had where to sit and eat (we woke up early, don't know if there's any room left if you get there at 9, 9.30). The elevator is small, but as the hotel is not very big it doesn't take too long. The location is great. There are several restaurants, transport options and even a supermarket across the street. The Librairie Gilbert Joseph is one block away and is amazing! The corner rooms I stayed in was a little bit weird: The toilet was separated from the bath and sink, but it was nothing I couldn't live with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: FMGC
Reviews.Content: Great location in Rive Gauche, within short distance from various metro stations. Although the room was quite small, it had everything necessary for a comfortable stay - tea making facilities, comfy bed with good linen, very clean and, despite being so near Blvd San Michel, it was quiet at night. Free teatime buffet was great to tide over until later and breakfast had reasonable choice and was available 7.30 - 10.30am. However if everyone wanted to eat at a similar time, the breakfast room became overcrowded. Many of the interesting locations are within walking distance and the surrounding area was ideal for sauntering and exploring. Staff pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: elive_c
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the hotel. Just off the Blvd St Michael the hotel is very clean, staff were very friendly and welcoming. We stayed in a standard double room its quite small but this was expected from reviews. Nice power shower, fridge, tea making facilities and very comfy bed with fluffy pilliows, Flat screen TV with BBC 1 and 2, was cosy and romantic. This is our 2nd visit to Paris and decided to try the latin quarter this hotel is right of 1 of the main streets and resturants and bar's are within 5-10min walk. There are lots of metro stations near the hotel to get you to the main sights like the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysee. If you are coming on Eurostar Gare Du Nord I recommend getting the RER B to St Michael Notre Dame then just walk up Blvd St Michael. Next time we go back to Paris we will definatly be staying in this hotel and would highly recommend for anyone else of all ages who want to be in the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive for the size and quality”
Reviews.Author: ladyandtramp
Reviews.Content: This isn't just about the hotel but our experiences there, so we have tried to explain why, if you don't expect these experiences the hotel might rate higher. There were workmen on site painting, drilling, sanding from before 0900 to about 1700 each day. We think any hotel should give prior notice or a price reduction for the disruption. Loss of one star. The key to our door failed to work, resulting in us having to chase up a member of staff to lock and unlock our door every time we left/entered the room. It took 24 hours to get it working and during that time we had to explain the problem to each new person on the front desk. It got really tedious and no real apology or alternative was offered. Poor customer service - loss of one star. Bathroom so small as to be barely functional - loss of one star. We know that the rooms in Paris tend to be small, particularly in the Latin Quarter, but this was too small. As you see from the photo you can’t stretch out your arms inside the room. A 5’11/180cm person could just about sit on the toilet – even then it became tricky when they turned the radiators on full; scalded knees a severe risk. Any larger would be sitting sideways at all times. Bedroom so cramped there is barely room to navigate between bed and chair. My wife and I had to take it in turns to do anything in the room - loss of one star. All the staff at the hotel were pleasant and polite – but I find this normal at most, if not all, Best Western Hotels. Basically there are loads of Best Western hotels in Paris that offer better value. We stayed at 3 others in the same area that were allegedly only 3 star but the only difference we noticed between this 4 star hotel and them … was in the price. This hotel was 40% more expensive and not noticeably better. The management will probably claim that small rooms are normal for this region of Paris – so go with the cheaper hotels – you might as well save the money. They’re just the same quality. Otherwise – if you are not familiar with Paris you might be surprised how small it is. A carnet costs (Dec 2011) under 13€ for 10 journeys – and it takes about 15 minutes to go from even the edge of the periphery to the center. Find a less dense area, get more value for money and let the train take the strain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Close to Boulevard Saint Michel”
Reviews.Author: Mike4627
Reviews.Content: The Belloy is situated in a busy side street, Rue Racine, and next to the vibrant Boulevard Saint Michel with its many restaurants and shops. The Luxembourg RER/Metro station is a pleasant 8 minute stroll away next to the delightful Jardin de Luxembourg. The location is perfect if you are visiting the Parc des Expositions, as I was, but want to stay in central Paris. The RER journey is approximately 35 minutes and no train changes are needed. A 5 minute walk in the opposite direction along Boulevard Saint Michel takes you to the Seine, the Pantheon, the Isle de la Cité and Notre Dame cathedral. Or turn left along Boulevard Saint Germain and reach the heart of the Latin Quarter and experience the real Paris. Rue Racine is narrow and often blocked by traffic. Bear this in mind if you are waiting for a taxi as access to the hotel entrance is often restricted. The hotel is cosy with a small reception area and a lift (elevator) to all floors, including the basement where breakfast is served. My wife and I stayed at the Belloy for two nights, 29th/30th November. We had booked a de-luxe room and were reasonably satisfied with the accommodation on the 3rd floor. The rooms are small, typical for Paris, but well furnished. The Queen sized bed was very comfortable with a firm mattress, which we both prefer. The small toilet was separate and next to the bathroom, which contained both bath and shower and a hairdryer, one of those items you often forget to bring with you. A flat screen TV was provided, which could receive BBC1 and BBC2 channels (English). Our welcome at the hotel was warm enough and the receptionist offered us a glass of champagne, advised that breakfast was included in our room rate (Euros 210 per night) - I was aware of this at the time of booking - and that a free afternoon tea was served between 5:30 and 7:00pm. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a wholesome variety of cereals, fruit, breads and rolls, boiled eggs, croissants, pastries, cheeses, cold meats, tea and coffee. The waiting staff however were somewhat surly... Overall I've rated the hotel 4/5. There were little niggles, which I don't expect when I'm spending this kind of money. On arrival we found no bath towels in the bathroom, just hand towels and I had to ask reception to send some up. The carpet in our room was badly stained and in need of replacement. Although we had tea/coffee making facilities in the room they were not replenished on day two. Small irritations that are so easily avoided if management and staff are more attentive. Overall however we enjoyed our stay here. The location is perfect to experience Paris. Would I stay at the Belloy again? Yes, I would. Just a little more attention to detail required.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel if you want to be near the Latin Quarter and Notre Dame. The location is convenient for the metro, RER, and buses. Our room was spacious and clean. There was a bathtub and plenty of hot water. The bed was comfortable. The room was a comfortable temperature. The window could be opened, but when closed there was no noise from the street or traffic. The breakfast buffet had a large variety of choices including cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurt, meats and cheeses. The staff was accommodating. The only negative comment I have is that the walls are thin, so noise and conversations from other rooms could be heard.

Reviews.Title: “Veri good”
Reviews.Author: zagash
Reviews.Content: Just a little expensive, but with a good service, good rooms, good location and good international breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An OK experience”
Reviews.Author: BillieNickwill
Reviews.Content: Pros The location is superb, very close to Odeon Metro station and Saint Germain (the best night life area in Paris in my opinon). 2 minutes walking distance to the RER station that takes you to the airport. The rooms: We had a standard room, and it was cosy, very clean and well maintained, quiet so you'll have a good nights sleep, very well equipped (soaps, shampoos, towels, free non alcoholic beverages in the mini bar (great plus), wardrobe with plenty of hangers, coffee/tea/cream/sugar/waterboiler. Free wifi. Cons Juice and milk for breakfast are served luke warm. Service in the reception was very poor and sometimes rude. Neutral I can see that many are complaining about small rooms and elevators. Yes, everything in this hotel is super tiny, but that's just the way it is in this part of Paris. It didn't bother us, it's actually very cosy. If large rooms and elevators are important, you must double the price and book a room in one of the big hotels in the more expensive part of Paris. If the staff had been just a little bit friendly we would love to come back here, but service is 95% of the experience for me, so I think I'll try another hotel next time I'm in Paris. Still I can see that a lot of people here are very happy with the staff, so we might have had bad luck.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not much bigger than the bed”
Reviews.Author: Carolingan
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, free wifi throughout the hotel, these are th plus. On the minus side tiny room (mine was supposed to be a Superior) I would hate to see a Standard. I booked a Superior Double room and got 2 single beds shoved together with separate bedding. Tiny lift takes forever. Overall the location makes it but very pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! I re be back”
Reviews.Author: francesLau
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us all that is needed, the location was at the beginning of a quite road this avoided the traffic noise and only 1-2min walk and you re into the main busy road, it is within easy reach to the metro ( Cluny line) abt 5min walk. The hotel staffs were so friendly, they were helpful with all kinds of questions from us and speak good English. The room was a bit small but then all Paris hotels have small rooms and very clean and cosy, although the breakfast room was very small and limited seats but the breakfast can fill your stomach up all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: DrewGAZ
Reviews.Content: Great location! Rooms typically small for Paris, but you shouldnt be spending much time in your room, it's PARIS! The hotel is right off of Blvd St Michel in the Latin QTR, which has many cafes and restaurants within a short walking distance. Area was safe and very active and fun night life b/c of it's proximity to the universities. Several metro stations to choose from, so getting around Paris was quick and easy. Also, our travel agent advised the hotel that i just got engaged and they upgraded my fiancee and I upon arrival! What a nice touch!! Also, it should be noted, the management responds to most reviews on Tripadvisor, which speaks volume about the professionalism of this hotel's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: Barbstur
Reviews.Content: We quickly booked a room in this hotel after learning that our first hotel choice had a fire and were unable to accommodate us. But no real complaints here. We knew going in that we weren't staying in a five star hotel. We also figured our room would be small and the elevator would be miniscule. We were right about those things, but our room was serviceable and clean. The bed was comfortable and we had a very nice bathroom even if it wasn't spacious. The best thing was that we could open windows in the bedroom and bathroom and get cross ventilation making it breezy and very comfortable at night. I would say the best thing about this hotel is its breakfast room which is located in the cellar and is quite beautiful with stone walls and a sort of medieval decor. The woman who served in the breakfast room was very nice and accommodating. We got off to a good start in the mornings. The staff at the front desk was also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: veggienb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in May. Here is an outline of the pros and cons. Positive features: - location, location, location! - free wifi - free breakfast - fast check in - complimentary tea time snacks Cons: - construction, was never informed at the time of booking. Don't plan to sleep past 8am. - elevator needs servicing as everytime it stops at a floor, it will make a loud thump and resonate through the building, not enjoyable at 1am in the morning. - carpets need to be replaced, they are old and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice service; overall OK.”
Reviews.Author: Molly29660
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my grown-up daughter, the hotel is OK, the decoration is a bit dark and feels a bit dated. We were lucky to stay there over a week-end, - there is a facade refurbishment. The reception was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was OK, pity nothing hot like an omelett or scrumbled eggs. There were nice details like a Champagne glass, afterfnoon tea and free soft drinks bar in the room. It was close to metro and RER, although we were mostly walking or taking a cab. Good TV channel selection, apart from French (obviously!) at least 1 of each; English, German, Spanish, Italien and even Russian channel. It was a nice experience after all, but I doubt I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dog-Friendly-Paris
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel which warmly welcomed us and our American Staffordshire Terrier dog (weight 32kg or 70lbs) when we visited from Australia. Very central location on the border of the 5th and 6th arrondissements about half way between Luxemboug gardens and the river which were both only minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly hospitable and personal, delightfuly charming yet located within 100m of the Seine and Notre Dame.”
Reviews.Author: Rosie3181
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many types of accomodation, including 5+ star hotels for business and pleasure. This is the first hotel where I have stayed which offered a buffet tea inclusive in the room charge. Even though I didn't always want it, it was such a nice touch. That and the welcome glass of champagne on arrival. The staff on the front desk and the housekeeping staff were always friendly, helpful and polite without being intrusive. While the hotel footprint was small, and the interior very compact, this was appropriate for the suburb in Paris in which it is located. The location, by the way,100 meters from the Seine and Notre Dame couldn't be better. Despite it's compactness, the decor, the ambience and views from the rooms were distinctly and typically Parisian while retaining all the cleanliness and functionality of a well managed hotel service. I seldom take the trouble to provide feedback, but I was delighted to have found such a charming hotel within my price range, right in the middle of where I wanted to be in Paris, and I have already recommended the hotel to my brother and his wife who are also planning to stay there in early March. A friend who was staying in Paris at a nearby hotel at the time of my stay, visited my room and commented on how lovely she found it, value for money and she also made a comparison of the wifi speeds between the two hotels and felt that BW.BS-G was considerably faster. She has made a note to stay there for future visits to Paris. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: justinchopper
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel on a 2 day business trip to Paris. The hotel is nice, cosy, rooms a bit small for the price paid but overall ok. Free wifi is a bonus and free minibar in the room is nice too. The breakfast is however a bit weak and needs to be upgraded. The hotel is central and reachable by underground. a lot of shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Would never, ever, NEVER stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SDLAW
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that Best Western put their name on this hotel. The location in the Latin Quarter is good if you like a lot of action. The car horns (and the French seem to love their horns) are plentiful along with the general sounds of masses of people on St. Michel Blvd. Its proximity to the colleges makes it quite the hangout area so could be fun all through the night if you don't mind the noise. I had to wear ear plugs. There are some pros to the place. It is clean (I checked for bed bugs), has free WiFi along with a guest computer, beverages stocked in the mini-fridge and includes a minimal breakfast (which was served in what seemed like a dungeon -- two small basement rooms encased by rock). There is complimentary happy-hour wine in the lobby. It seems like a very safe area although there was an incident on the last morning when a very aggressive bag lady came into the lobby and was stuffing the hotel's snack items into her cargo pants. When she was asked to leave, she caused quite a scene complete with cussing and spitting. The desk clerk (didn't get his name but he was the nicer one) tried to lock her out but the front doors weren't working, which leads me to the elevator. When we arrived, the elevator worked but is small beyond belief. It fit two suitcases and the two of us and THAT IS IT. If we had a small child with us, he would have had to be held or put on top of the luggage. The rest of the time, the elevator worked intermittently so we walked several trips to/from the 4th floor. We were offered the service elevator which is a cylinder in a dark cage that can only fit one to two people. We chose the stairs. Upon arrival, I took one look at the room and went back to the desk and asked if that was what we were supposed to get. I was informed that my travel agent booked a standard room (at the mere price of $276/night US dollars). This room looked nothing like the picture on Best Western's site. NOTHING. I measured because it was so ridiculous. I know that rooms in Paris can be tight but I had never seen a hotel room this small in my life, and I've traveled a lot. Give or take an inch, here are the sizes: bedroom 9'x10', bathroom 4'9"x5'7" including a shower of 29"x29". Every time I turned around in the shower, I turned the water off because I couldn't help but hit the handle. The closet is actually laughable, 16"x19". There is no dresser, just some small shelves next to the closet. Because there was no counter space in the bathroom, I used the bedroom radiator to hold my hair curler. In order to open a suitcase, the entry door had to be blocked. We each had one suitcase and only one bag at a time could be horizontal unless you wanted to sleep in the bed with it. And I use the word "sleep" loosely. The double bed was hard as a rock and had there been floor space, I might have opted for it because it might have been cooler. They advertise air conditioning which didn't cool at all. There is a mounted unit at the ceiling in the corner of the room and it gives off a little whiff of air, not cool, not hot, just air. The french doors (no balcony) couldn't be left open because of the noise. The room came with two bath towels and two plastic cups; there was a hand towel or two in there also. I needed an extra towel which shouldn't have had to be explained. On our way back in, my husband asked the desk clerk for another towel and perhaps a pillow (because our three were like pancakes). The clerk asked if we already had two towels and I explained that I needed to wash my hair so needed an extra. None of his business why I needed one but I offered the justification. The clerk showed his dissatisfaction but came back with a towel a couple of minutes later. My husband then asked again about getting another pillow. The clerk got pretty snippy telling my husband that he should have asked for it when he requested the towel. Hubby did! We hiked up the stairs (elevator not working) and passed a maid in the hallway with an open closet door with several pillows lined up. We asked if we could have one and she obliged. I should mention here that the hotel book in our room states that "if you need anything, just ask." Really?? We had another instance with this same clerk but enough about him. I doubt that all Latin Quarter rooms are like this so I would look harder if you are set on staying there. Saint-Germain-des-Pres is the next neighborhood over. It seems a bit quieter and in just as good of location. On the west side, at the end of the Metro lines, you can get 4-star hotels for decent prices (Paris decent prices anyways). I've stayed at both the Renaissance La Defense and the Evergreen Laurel, both worlds apart from this place. If you choose to stay at the Best Western Belloy St. Germain, well, I warned you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: dao9j
Reviews.Content: I suppose for paris on a budget this is a good hotel but I would have paid more for a hotel with parking if I'd known how difficult and expensive it would be to park the car. The hotel looked run down on the outside, everything was very cramped from the hotel lobby to the rooms and to where you have breakfast but for the position in the Latin Quarter it was probably the best you could get at such a reasonable price. The room was comfortable, air con a bit noisy but you could open the window in the bathroom for air and not too much noise. Free Wifi but it got overloaded at night, breakfast included and not bad. Nothing cooked but cold meats, cheeses, bread, fruit etc. My only complaint was the bathroom, we had a bath but no plug I asked for one but it never materialised. The shower door kept coming open and flooding the floor and the shower head was about 10 feet up the wall so you hed to set the temperature to scalding to get a reasonable heat, which was ok but you had to reach under the water flow to do it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: richciara
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we were a little bit worried, but our room was really lovely, with a complimentary soft drinks bar and a really comfy bed. The only criticism would be that the dining room for breakfast, doesn't really accommodate the number of guests and we did have to queue up at one stage. Overall the hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Notre Dame and St Michel, which is on the RER and only half an hour from CDG airport

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: sciencesam
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Paris with my best friend. Having researched the various areas in Paris and read many reviews we decided to book the Belloy Best Western. It turned out to be a good decision. We flew into CDG airport and boarded a train direct to Luxembourg station. This was a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Very convenient. We arrived in the morning, but were unable to check in until 2pm. The hotel has storage for bags, so we were able to freshen up and head out sightseeing. When we checked in we were given a triple room. The room seemed spacious for what I expected from a city hotel in an old building. There were twin beds, pushed together as a double and another single bed. The bathroom was clean with a bath and overhead shower, and a toilet cubicle. There was a flat screen TV and a minibar with soft drinks. These are replenished every couple of days. There is a small supermarket just up the road which sells wine, snacks and drinks if needed. In the lounge area is a tray of drinks, with an honesty box, if you fancy a nightcap! The beds were reasonably comfy and the air conditioning kept the room lovely and cool. Breakfast can get very busy. The earlier you go down the better. The choice is fairly good. From 5.30-8pm a light snack is served in the dining room. You are also given a welcome glass of champagne, which you can collect from 3pm on any day. The free wi-fi was very easy to connect to on my I-touch, you can also use the computer in the lounge area free for one hour. The hotel is on the edge of the st-germain and latin quarter districts. There are lots of restaurants and bars, and they become lively at night. It is also a short walk to the Seine, for an evening stroll. During the day the Cluny metro station is a 2 minute walk, with day rovers fairly cheap. The Notre-Dame is about ten minutes on foot as are many landmarks. The Luxembourg Gardens are closeby if you want to spend a few hours relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to Paris Icons!”
Reviews.Author: Aussieseurosummer
Reviews.Content: The petite hotel was just excellent. Typical small room that had everything to make us comfortable. The A/C worked a traet in the extreme heat. The breakfast accross the road was just fine as was the budget complimentry dinner. They need to increase the wine selection thought. The key for us was super friendly staff working in a very confined space. Every person was excellent at their english and assisted with general directions and bookings. A delight to stay in a friendly hotel & excellent location to the underground & cafes/restaurants. We would stay again only longer next visit. Mark & Teddy Australia

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Sergio303631
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, specially because it is a few meters from the train station where you can take a train to the airport. The breakfast is OK and they offer a free "tea time" in the evening, which was a plus. The free Internet was good too. Unfortunately, the staff is rude, mainly at te front desk, and the walls are too thin, so you need luck not to have noisy neighbors, otherwise you will have a hard time to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Angela075
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a convenient locatation, a few minutes walk from the Metro and open top bus stop. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The rooms are very small and should have air conditioning. The day we arrived the temperature was 34C and we were given a room in full sun and no air conditioning. The recepionist was very rude on our arrival and when we asked to change rooms. He told us various lies. When he was told to contact the manager and start ringing around other Best Western Hotels to find us an alternative room he miraculously found us another room with air-con. This is a small hotel, The breakfast is limited but adequate. The location is convenient. But the experience was spoilt but the exceptionally rude receptionist. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: letsgolotso
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner in March 2010 for 3 nghts. We were given a room on the 5th floor. After reading the previous reviews, I was expecting the room to be tiny, but it was actually quite spacious and very clean. The only thing I did not like about the room is that the toilet and bathroom were in seperate rooms and there was no sink to wash hands where the toilet was. We paid about Â£100 per night and thought this good value considering that within that price incuded, a glass of champagne per person, breakfast, afternoon tea and free wi-fi. We never had to wait for a table at breakfast, but we liked to go at 7.30am to get the most out of our day. Best of all was the location. Close by to Notre Dame. Easy to reach metro / RER stations. Less than a 5 minute walk to get to the RER B station to get to CDG airport - good as we had an early flight home. Finally, we discovered that they serve an express breakfast from 5am in the lobby, which was useful given our early flight home. Hotels in Paris are not cheap, but I think this one offers good value and if we do visit Paris again we would be happy to return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and SUPERB Value”
Reviews.Author: scochelle
Reviews.Content: Especially when comparing to other hotels such as the Marriotts of the world, this hotel has EXCELLENT value. Our room rate of approx $169 Euros (which in the latin district is an outstanding price) includes free wifi, free breakfast, free dinner (tea time), free glass of champagne & free mini-bar (non alc beverages). All also within the best of areas in my opinion. Walking to all sorts of cafes, pubs, transit and tourist attractions such as notre dame. One thing i didnt like about it was the beds were really hard and the room was small. Honestly though, it didnt bother us that much considering is is a heritage building, and the character of the rooms and beds felt very "authentic". Service was helpful also, especially during the breakfast and when we accidentally left our passports behind in the safe!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: AnnaPSeattle
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean; rooms are very small and clean. But the staff is so rude and unprofessional. The hotel had a comment section on their web site. However, they get rid of it because they receive so many comments about their unprofessional staff and terrible customer service from the guests all over the world. Not good for hotel business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hfbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Belloy for three nights from 8th March 2010. The hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance from Notre Dame and the Loovre, plus a number 38 bus from the Eurostar terminal at Gare Du Nord takes you nearly to the end of Rue Racine. The room was small but spotlessly clean, and as the weather was bitterly cold during our stay this meant that the large radiator kept us very cosy. There was also an aircon unit in the room, so I don't think the summer heat would be a problem either. There was a good variety of items on the breakfast buffet, and although the breakfast room was small they'd made the most of the space available, and we only had a short wait one morning for a table. We tried the evening buffet the day we arrived. It was nothing too exciting but as we didn't want to go out in the cold again it was a great free option. There were a lot of restaurants within a short walk, and a Monoprix supermarket just up the road. I'd recommend this hotel for a short stay in Paris, and we'll stay there again when we next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable little "family style" hotel but don't expect facilities”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: This is a VERY small hotel in a nice central location. Only ate breakfast there so not even sure there's a restaurant, but hey,this is Paris and you wouldn't want to eat in your hotel anyway. Nicely renovated old building (especially the breakfst room in the stone-walled cellar) but given that it's squeezed into that old building, everything is TINY!. I'm talking not being able to open the door fully into your room because the door hits the bed... and if if there are two of you don't try and go in the bathroom together! Room and bathroom were dull and not particularly nice, decor tired-looking, but clean, and stuff worked. Staff (I only ever saw one memer of staff at a time in the whole hotel, on reception!) were variable: one very curt, unfriendly and not helpful, another, very friendly and chatty. A small sample though, but we got the whole spectrum! If you need a hotel with facilities, this is not the one (I had to wait an hour when I asked for an iron because "IT" was being used - yes, one iron for the whole hotel! Comical, if I hadn't been in a rush) but if, say, it's a leisure break where you intend only to sleep there, this is fine at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice extras”
Reviews.Author: travel123Manchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in a nice area of St Germain / The Latin Quarter on the Left Bank. We stayed for 2 nights and found the room to be pleasant although compact. They allowed us to check in when we arrived at 11am as they had availibility which we really appreciated. I liked the all in one package, glass of champagne, breakfast, soft drinks in the mini bar, wifi, an hour on the internet. The staff where pleasant, epecially the girl who checked us in. Breakfast was a bit chaotic, although we where late risers we found there to be dishes on the tables, no plates or mugs etc so i would get down early. If you are going to Paris make yourself familiar with the metro / RER it is so easy to use and very cheap. We travelled efficiently all over Paris. From CDG get the blue line (3) to Luxembourg for 8,5 Euros one way. You are then within aprox 7 minutes walk of the hotel. Beware of young boys claiming you have dropped something - normally a gold ring and then giving it to you in exchange for money. It's a con. Do visit the Opera house, one of the most fantastic buildings in Paris. The view from the Tour (Tower) Montparnasse is great. The Luxembourg Gardens are also lovely. We booked the restaurant opposite, Boullion Racine the food was very good and we had a proper french experience in beautiful art deco surroundings. (Not a cheap eat but worth it). I found the French people to be more than helpful, not at all arrogant and very welcoming. Even people on the metro advised us of which stops to get off at or which line to take! Lovely city, lovely people and lovely food, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel, great location with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AlNic
Reviews.Content: This has only been our second time in Paris and first impressions of the room was small. We stayed for four nights then realised the room was more than adequate. TV, tea/coffee kettle and fridge with free drinks, no rip off mini bar and free in room safe. Breakfast isn't the best we have had but again it was adequate along with the free buffet tea the hotel provides. The staff were nice and helpful and we even printed off our return online booking tickets for our return flight. The free hotel Wifi is excellent should you want to take your laptop etc. We found the best feature of the hotel was the location .A 5 minute walk to Notre Dame and about 2 minutes walk to the RER underground train station which is a direct link the CDG airport for a mere 7.50 euros. When we travel we tend not to return to the same hotel but would probably consider this one again. Our beds were comfy and the rooms were clean, not that quiet but quiet enough for the centre of a major European City. People who expect total silence may wish to consider staying in the countryside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation in a Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Been2EuropeManyTimes
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times before, but this trip was "special" because my wife and I recently celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary, our son had moved to Paris (June 2009), and we had never been to Paris during the winter. All-in-all, our experience at the hotel was superb from the room (which was very clean and cozy) to the quality of the staff, to the food...everything was just great and made for a wonderful stay. I'd heartily recommend this hotel, especially to someone who does not speak French very well because the entire staff was extremely helpful with directions, getting cabs, and reconfirming airline reservations. A GREAT hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “trying to contact the manager”
Reviews.Author: kiwiHongKong
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately due to the adverse weather over Christmas I was unable to make it to Paris and had to cancel my booking at the Belloy. I have emailed the hotel 4 times in an effort to sort out the possibility of a refund. Sadly no one at the hotel has replied to me. It is always interesting when there is a hiccup, especailly due to no fault on your behalf, to see what response and assistance a hotel gives. I had to fill in the review scale but of course I have not idea because i never got. there

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: riccirj
Reviews.Content: Very Good Good Points Free and Very good wireless Nice staff Clean Near to the Subway Bad Points Computer was not working They don't replace towels on weekends because the laundry does not work. They took all the towels to wash and didn't put other on place. We are used to take bath every day and several times twice a day. So I had to ask for the towels in saturday and sunday because they took it off.

Reviews.Title: “great deal nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FedeF
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel because my favorite restaurant in Paris is in front of it in rue Racine. The hotel is small, centrally located, near metro stop Odeon and Cluny-La Sorbone, but St.Michel station is also few steps far. Some nice benefits were provided by the hotel manager, like wifi for free, an internet corner in the lobby, minibar included in all rooms, breakfast buffet in the room rate. I had unit 609 and I saw unit 610 which are both enough spacious and quiet rooms on the top floor. I have found this hotel a great deal. The lift is slow and in the morning you'd better go down using stairs, but I wouldn't consider this a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff- I will stay here next time!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller200010
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel. The Manager was very nice & professional. This hotel offers many extras. The rooms are good size and very clean, need not say anymore!!! Highly recommended! Close to everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good experience over all apart from chaos at breakfast which let it down”
Reviews.Author: IrishEyes000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at end of september 2009 for our anniversary and we were not disappointed. We hoped being a Best Western we could expect a certain standard. We previously stayed in 2 other hotels in Paris and this was by far the best.I let my husband open the door to the room while I waited in the hall for his verdict as I was nervous it was going to be a tiny cramped room but....relief, it was really lovely.The room was nicely spacious,obviously newly decorated which was very tasteful. The bed was very big but a bit too firm. Also the sheets were very hard which made for an uncomfortable sleep.Maybe fabric conditioner hasn't reached this hotel yet. We were pleased to find tea and coffee making faciliites in the room. Also they gave us a card on arrival which entitled us to a glass of champagne we thought this was a little something for our anniversary but everyone could have one.It was quite nice actually, not rocket fuel.There was a new flat screen tv on the wall, a well stocked fridge, an extra pillow and towels in the cupboard and the air con worked very efficiently, and it wasn't noisy as in other hotels. There was also free wi-fi if I remember correctly. As mentioned on this website, there are 2 lifts, one is so small my husband had to squash himself tightly behind me in order for both of us to fit in, and we aren't tall people, so that was fun. It was expected from paris hotels were space is at a premium, it was very cute. But there was another lift which was much bigger, though that wouldn't have been hard, which with the 2 of us and our 2 cases was full.But it was fine. The double glazing definately kept the noise out from the Boulevard Saint Michel, which is a busy busy main road.Speaking of the windows,when I was having a shower I left the door open to talk to my husband and noticed the hotel accross the road could see straight into the bathroom! Was quite funny!Me with my shower hat on looking awful! The breakfast would have been nice if we could've found somewhere to sit down, its downstairs in what is like a couple of caves, very nice, if a bit dimly lit, so bring your torch. It was utter chaos!! Worse than Butlins. It was so busy it wasn't funny, actually you just had to laugh and then turn around and leave! When the food was gone it really was gone, it wasn't replenished. The tables were not cleared, so people had to sit at tables with piles of used plates etc on them, which isn't nice, especially first thing in the morning.The 2nd morning I didn't even bother to venture down, my husband ended up eating a few spoonfulls of cereal, as that was all that was left, standing up in a corner! We weren't late to breakfast, about 9am ish.Who wants to get up at 7.30am when you're away on holiday?? There is a monoprix, kind of a small M & S, a few steps away where you could pick up a sandwich or salad and water.so don't panic. The hotel provided a small buffet about 5.30pm which was a nice surprise, we found bread, cheeses, tea &coffee,things like salmon terine, italian ham so we were very happy and as it was empty, we could sit wherever we liked. Most of the reception staff were nice apart from a young lady, who's english was nearly non-existent. Apart the bed being too hard and the chaos at breakfast, I would recommend this hotel without a doubt.The location of this hotel was probably its best selling point, it was close to the RER We flew in to CDG airport, hoped on line B (blue), no changes which was a relief as the train was packed at times and stayed on till Cluny La Sorbonne and walked about 6-7 mins to the hotel.Voila.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TK1956
Reviews.Content: Small room by our standards but ok for our purposes, being tourists. RER & Metro nearby. Breakfast & afternoon snack included in price was limited but did the job. Fantastic location, 5 mins to the Seine, Notre Dame. Great restaurant area down the laneway opposite the RER stairway on the way down the hill to the Seine. Great deals to be had. We had a 3 course meal and a glass of wine for 10 Euro each. This place was recommended by a friend and we would return. Staff at the front desk spoke good english which helped with my poor French and were very helpful (bus info, how to use Metro carnets etc)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris because Paris is ALWAYS a good idea!”
Reviews.Author: kamsg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from August 19 through August 23. It was a great location-- very close to Notre Dame. The subway system was a half block away. We were within a short walking distance to The Latin Quarter as well as The St. Germain shopping area! We also walked to the Lourve (about 15 minutes). One of the hotel managers, Ante, was extremely accommodating and helpful to all our questions. He spoke excellent English which was comforting to three ladies in Paris for our first time. The room was decorated very nicely and extremely clean. Breakfast was great in the morning, afternoon tea, and champagne toasts. It was an excellent place to stay--would most definitely go back there next time to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelingilley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Belloy St. Germain. We stayed 3 nights and had a charming corner room facing St. Michel Blvd with a great view of Notre Dame from our window. The hotel is typical Paris, small rooms but efficient. They're clean with excellent daily room cleaning. We didn't take advantage of breakfast with so many excellent cafe choices in the area. We could barely hear some street noise at night but the double pane windows kept it to a minimum and was not disruptive. The metro and RER train are a block away and we utilized them often. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms tiny”
Reviews.Author: JohnDGalway
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BW Belloy at end of August . Nice clean Hotel with helpful staff in a great location with easy access to metro, restauraunts in the boho part of Paris. Notre Dame, Pantheon and Jardin de Luxembourg within 5-10mins walk. However .... bedroom was tiny and pics on the web are misleading. Breakfast was uncomfortable due to the poor layout, lack of available seating and food counter continuously running out of food. Free minibar consists of about â‚¬5 worth of supplies (cola, water etc). Room cleaning was haphazard. Felt this hotel were overpriced for the value given.

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest room ever I stayed: not a room but a rat-hole”
Reviews.Author: debonaire1882
Reviews.Content: We all know that European hotels are notorious for their small sizes. And BW Belloy Saint-Germain will top the list of the entire continent. And sadly enough they dont charge you any less, infact it was one of the most expensive hotels that I stayed during my 3 weeks summer vaccation in Europe. I stayed there for 4 nights and regret for that. I will advice my fellow travelers not to fall for the trap by looking at the beautiful hotel room pictures that you see on their advertisements. You will be surprised to see how small the rooms are and somewhow they appear bigger on their advertisements. After puttting two mid sized bags there was no space in the room to walk. You will have to jump to the bed from the door as there will be no room for you to put a step anywhere. And I am not exaggerating a bit! The corridors are so tiny that two people won't be able to pass each other. One has to give room to the other to pass. They have one elevator which can accommodate three person at a time and it takes 5 minutes to get down from 3rd floor to the ground floor - that is also if you are lucky enough to catch it after 15 minutes of wait. I used to take the stairs and never minded about the elevator. Now, the management of BW Belloy Saint-Germain came up with a brilliant idea of offering value by bundling in free breakfast, free WiFI, free mini bar (replenshied every 4 days - can't laugh enough), one glass of champagne and tea-time buffet (which we did not find anywhere) on top of their tiny rooms. In my humble opinion, inclusive of all these extra frills, the room price should not be more that half of what they charge. Moreover, the breakfast was very basic - comprises of only bread, butter and jelly. And the tiny breakfast room can accommodate only 12-15 people at a time, so you have to be very to get a seat. The only good thing about this hotel is free internet. If you are not carrying your laptop they have a computer where you get 1 hour internet free. The location of the hotel is not that great. we had a nightmare to reach the hotel from Gare du Lyon Train station. You will not find a clear direction how to reach the hotel in their website. There is one metro station nearby - but you have to walk a lot to change lines. The metro is also not that clean in Paris. I found Paris to be dirty and filthy. A tip for the people who want to see the ChÃ¢teau de Versailles don't keep it for Mondays. We couldn't see the place since we kept it for Monday and it was clsoe and left Paris on the next day. My recommendation to all of you will be to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jcharnoff
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip in which I was in transit through Paris. I spent the night, here, and was thrilled with my decision. It was literally steps from the RER train from the airport. The front desk staff was incredible. The minibar, internet , and breakfast were all included. When I could not get into my AOL account on the computer, the front desk manager invited me to come around the desk and use her computer. While I was packing to leave, she printed directions for me to the restaurant where I wanted to eat. I would very highly reccomend this hotel, although the rooms are a drop small.

Reviews.Title: “I could count on Best Western Belloy Saint-Germain.”
Reviews.Author: tradeshowgirl10
Reviews.Content: My time in Paris was for business and the staff made my stay most pleasant. They were very helpful with advice and references. This hotel had the best location to shopping, dining and sightseeing. The day before I was due to leave, my purse was stolen from my workplace. Because of the lateness and location of the incident there was no one to assist or give advice. When I returned to Saint Germain, the hotel personnel was most attentive and helpful with information. My departure was delayed, but was assured that if they could not accommodate my added days they would find accommodations for me. It was great to know that with all I had to do (police, embassy) the Saint Germain hotel was the one I could count on.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful Management, Stolen items from room”
Reviews.Author: Semirasm
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this hotel with a group from our school. One of my classmates had items (jewelry and electronics) in the room before the room was cleaned. Multiple items were missing after the room was cleaned. We searched the room from top to bottom, and tried to get help from hotel management. The hotel manager is not helping, and we will have to file a police report. **Lesson - leave your valuables at home - there is a housekeeper that takes things at this hotel, and you won't get your items back**

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: ALF22SydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice with teenage children. 1st time in a twin room for 4 nights. Then a triple room for 3 nights after visiting Rome / Sorrento. The rooms were small, renovated and spotlessly clean. The hotel is located close to trains in a safe central busy area in walking distance of Notre-Dame. We ate at the local restaurants in the latin quarter and shopped at the Monoprix supermarkets for fruit and essentials. The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a coin operated laundromat around the corner. This hotel is close to everything and is a great place to stay to see all the Paris attactions by foot or public transport. The breakfast in the cosy restaurant is a terrific way to start the day. The daily lunch packs was a nice bonus. Free wireless internet in the room allowed you allowed you to keep in touch with family and friends and plan the next part of your holiday. My teenage girls loved this hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great location”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo_santista
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW Saint Germain in septemberÂ´08 during my honeymoon. We have chosen it because of its great location on the corner of Blvd.Saint Michel and very close to a subway station (Cluny-La Sorbone). The brakfast its just OK. The staff was very helpful. I cheked it when I had do buy an adpator for my camera and the attender teached me how to get to the next "FNAC". The location is the best in Paris, on the center of Saint Germain quartier.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay - Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: hudsons4china
Reviews.Content: I know people have had negative comments about this hotel, but I think you should look at the dates they wrote them. The hotel has had a facelift in most rooms. During our stay we enjoyed a clean and comfortable room. We had a room on the 5th floor facing the street. The room was completely surrounded on the outside by a balcony and so we heard no other guests in the hotel. The bathtub was a nice size and the little soaps were a nice touch. This was our 10th anniversary and it was such a good location to start our vacation with. Later we moved to the Le Meridian in another part of town, and found that it wasn't half as nice as the Best Western, but was more expensive. This hotel is so close to everything, that you really don't need to take the metros but if you do there are 2 lines plus ther RER very close. I would stay here again. By the way, we paid extra for the "superior room" instead of the regular room - it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: owlyn
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and we were surprised at how small the room was (9x12, plus bathroom with a 30"x30" shower stall). There was no dresser and only a very, very small closet (enough for maybe 6 articles of clothing), so we had to live out of our suitcases, which was not easy in a 9x12 room with a large double bed. Not much room to walk around. We were contstantly moving items to get at another item. However, the room was in very good condition, and very clean. The maid service was a bit erratic, but any problems were solved within minutes by the very helpful, multi-lingual front desk staff. Don't use their public internet service in the lobby- it is e18/hour, and no smaller increments. there is a 24 hour internet cafe one blovk away, where 15 minutes is e1.80. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is walking distance to Notre dame, and is only one block from a Metro/RER station with several lines. There is also a Monoprix store right around the corner, which makes picking up chaep, good snacks easy to do. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quaint”
Reviews.Author: faith_stl
Reviews.Content: The location is probably the biggest PRO of the hotel. It is near both the St. Germain and Latin Quarter areas. There are several metro and RER stops within short walking distance of the hotel. Notre Dame is a short 3-5 minute walk. There are many restaurants, bars, and shopping. The hotel decor is very quaint and while the rooms were small they were fine for what we needed. Breakfast was included (croissants, coffee, juice, and toast). The hotel is air-conditioned and the room included a mini-bar/fridge with beer, wine, soda, etc. There is a small elevator. Our only complaint is that we had a loud air-conditioning unit - besides that our stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “More than happy”
Reviews.Author: Merrykins
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after a bit of researching, and asked for a room on one of the higher levels, as previous reviews have siad the lower levels were a little loud. We were more than happy with the room, which was a bit small (but hey! We were is Paris! Why stay in the room??) but very clean and comfortable. There was a large window which went out onto a (very) small balcony which we weren't really keen to go out on, but the view from the window was lovely. The lifts are tiny, but my husband and I had a great giggle squishing into the teeeeeeeny lift in the stairwell (the main one is a bit bigger!) It's in a great position, so close to the metro, and across the road there are some fantastic shops and a huge range of restaurants, which were mainly quite inexpensive. The staff were friendly and helpful when we required help. We booked straight through Best Western website, and got quite a good deal, considering we stayed there in the middle of summer.I would definitely recommend to friends and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like a dolls house!”
Reviews.Author: Earby
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous reviews I had expected small rooms, however it has to be a fact that if you are over 6 foot and 200 pounds you will not fit. The room I had on the 4th was dangerous in so much as the french windows went floor to roof with a very pretty but totally useless guard rail out side, if the windows are fully open and one trips on the bed clothes or something the guard is at hip level and you will be laying dead in a Paris street! The bathroom also is tiny and using the loo would be better for the double jointed. Having said that the hotel is clean, well priced, with OK staff, good breakfast, mini bar, tea and coffee stuff in rooms, and in a great, fantastic area of the worlds greatest city. So yes I would go again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Belloy Saint-Germain
